dataset.title: Shore bird census and human uses at the beach of Doñana Natural Space

section.para: Vehicle-based transect along the Beach of the Natural Space of Doñana in SouthEast-NorthWest direction

section.title: Dataset access and use constraints
section.para: Principal:Public has granted a permission of type:Free for access and use upon request

section.title: Dataset legal obligation reporting
section.para: Council Directive 2009/147/EC on the conservation of wild birds;2003-11-30;publication
Formal acknowledgement of the dataset providers

online.onlineDescription: SEGUIMIENTO DE PROCESOS Y RECURSOS NATURALES EN EL PARQUE NACIONAL DE DOÑANA

para.literalLayout: Transect is conducted at constant speed (10-20 km/h) during the morning low tide. This allow higher visibility (sunlight coming from the back). Stops were made when necessary (counting or identification). Wind speed (6 categories from calm to gale), wind direction, sky conditions (6 categories from sunny to rainy), sea conditions (6 categories from calm to very rough) and human use of the beach were noted together with bird counts

section.para: Transect is conducted monthly between days 10 and 20 looking for the best morning tide. The about 25km transect was divided into three sections according to easily recognizable reference points.
